channel.title: InfoSec on PowerShell Magazine | For the most powerful community
channel.description: Recent content in InfoSec on PowerShell Magazine | For the most powerful community

item.title: Easily Defining Enums, Structs, and Win32 Functions in Memory
item.description: In the past, I’ve spoken extensively on how to use reflection to define enums, structs, and Win32 functions in PowerShell and the merits of doing so.

item.title: Kansa: A PowerShell-based incident response framework
item.description: Known unknowns and unknown unknowns If you follow information security, you know that information systems are constantly under attack and often fall victim to adversaries looking to make a quick buck, gain competitive advantage through theft of intellectual property or embarrass a target that they find politically or ideologically offensive.

item.title: Live Incident Response with PowerShell
item.description: We often see the offensive capabilities of PowerShell hit the headlines as it is more attractive. It’s good to know and see what attackers do to penetrate your network, execute code to remain undetected, move laterally, and steal administrative credentials.

item.title: Investigating PowerShell Attacks
item.description: “Huh, that’s weird. Look at this system. I think the attacker used PowerShell.” It was late summer 2012, and we were working on an incident response investigation for a Fortune 100 technology company compromised by an intruder attempting to steal intellectual property.

item.title: Posh-Shodan module for the Shodan service
item.description: What is Shodan? Shodan is a search engine that lets one find hosts on the internet using a variety of filters.

item.title: Veil-PowerView
item.description: I was led to PowerShell in the past few years as it began to rise to prominence in the information security community.

item.title: Introduction to the PoshSec Framework
item.description: In March of 2013 I had the desire to create an open source Security Information and Event Management system, also known as a SIEM.

item.title: Introduction to PoshSec
item.description: Security has always been a passion of mine. It was a few short years ago that I was sitting down having a friendly chat with Will Steele.

item.title: Owning Networks and Evading Incident Response with PowerShell
item.description: Up until several months ago, I was a member of a penetration test team tasked with compromising data centers and evading detection.

item.title: Security in a Changing World
item.description: If you surveyed the landscape of computer security a decade ago, you would find a world completely different than the one we live in today.
